SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.crypt

Enum Class KeyStoreType

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<KeyStoreType>
com.dua3.utility.crypt.KeyStoreType
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<KeyStoreType>, Constable
public enum KeyStoreType extends Enum<KeyStoreType>
KeyStoreType defines a set of constants representing different types of keystores. A keystore is a repository for storing cryptographic keys and certificates securely. Each constant corresponds to a specific keystore format, commonly used in cryptographic operations and secure communication protocols like SSL/TLS.

Supported keystore types include: - PKCS12: A popular format for storing cryptographic keys and certificates, supporting strong encryption. - JKS: A Java-specific format for securely managing keys and trusted certificates. - JCEKS: An extension of JKS providing additional support for strong encryption algorithms.

These formats enable secure storage and management of cryptographic materials, ensuring integrity and confidentiality, while also supporting interoperability between platforms.

  • Enum Constant Summary

    Enum Constants
    Enum Constant
    Description
    JCEKS
    Represents the Java Cryptography Extension KeyStore (JCEKS) format, an extended version of the Java KeyStore (JKS) providing support for stronger encryption algorithms.
    JKS
    Represents the Java KeyStore (JKS) type, a proprietary keystore format used in Java applications for managing cryptographic keys, certificates, and trusted certificate chains.
    PKCS12
    Represents the PKCS12 keystore format, a standard defined by the Public-Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS) #12.

  • Enum Constant Details

    • PKCS12

      public static final KeyStoreType PKCS12
      Represents the PKCS12 keystore format, a standard defined by the Public-Key Cryptography Standards (PKCS) #12. PKCS12 is widely used for securely storing cryptographic keys and certificates, enabling interoperability between various cryptographic systems and software. It supports strong encryption and is commonly used in SSL/TLS implementations.

    • JKS

      public static final KeyStoreType JKS
      Represents the Java KeyStore (JKS) type, a proprietary keystore format used in Java applications for managing cryptographic keys, certificates, and trusted certificate chains. Commonly utilized in Java environments for secure storage and cryptographic operations.

    • JCEKS

      public static final KeyStoreType JCEKS
      Represents the Java Cryptography Extension KeyStore (JCEKS) format, an extended version of the Java KeyStore (JKS) providing support for stronger encryption algorithms.

      JCEKS is commonly used when enhanced security features are required for storing cryptographic keys and certificates.

    • forExtension

      public static KeyStoreType forExtension(String extension)
      Determines the appropriate KeyStoreType for the provided file extension. This method maps common keystore file extensions to their corresponding KeyStoreType.
      Parameters:
      extension - the file extension to be matched to a KeyStoreType. It can optionally start with a dot (e.g., ".jks" or "p12").
      Returns:
      the KeyStoreType corresponding to the specified file extension.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided extension is not supported by any KeyStoreType.

    • getExtension

      public String getExtension()
      Retrieves the file extension associated with the current KeyStoreType.
      Returns:
      a string representing the file extension for the keystore type. Possible values include "p12" for PKCS12, "jks" for JKS, and "jceks" for JCEKS.

    • forPath

      public static KeyStoreType forPath(Path path)
      Determines the appropriate KeyStoreType based on the file path provided. This method extracts the file extension from the provided Path and maps it to the corresponding KeyStoreType.
      Parameters:
      path - the Path representing the keystore file. The file extension will be derived from the path to identify the keystore type.
      Returns:
      the KeyStoreType corresponding to the file extension of the provided path.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the file extension from the path is unsupported by any KeyStoreType.

    • forPath

      public static KeyStoreType forPath(String path)
      Determines the appropriate KeyStoreType for the given file path. This method extracts the file extension from the provided path and maps it to the corresponding KeyStoreType.
      Parameters:
      path - the file path from which the keystore type will be determined. It is expected to be a valid string containing a file extension.
      Returns:
      the KeyStoreType corresponding to the file extension in the path.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the file extension is not supported by any KeyStoreType.
